messages.subject: Re:] Re Play dough
messages.msgSnippet: No, it comes out quite tasty.  You couldn t slice it for sandwiches, but it s great plain, or dipped into peanut butter, etc. I let them play with it as long
messages.messageBody:
No, it comes out quite tasty. You couldn't slice it for sandwiches, but
it's great plain, or dipped into peanut butter, etc.
I let them play with it as long as they want to. They usually do a
variety of "snakes", balls, or cut out with cookie cutters. One child
once made a "person" with a round face, and pieces for hair, eyes, etc.
I usually bake at 350 for 8 to 12 minutes.
Mary Ellen
Creating, acting, changing. That is eternal JOY.

>>>You can also make any recipe bread dough and let the kids "playdough"
with it, then bake their creations and eat them. Mary Ellen

>>>Really? It doesn't hurt the dough to have it "kneaded" so much, or
cut into little pieces?
Nanci K. in Idaho>>>>
